tourBios.exmtStatus: Subject to first reshuffle (first four events)
tourBios.carHigh: 2013: Earned 2014 Web.com Tour status by finishing second on the PGA TOUR Canada Order of Merit. Made the cut in six of nine starts and had three top-10 finishes. Earned his first career win at The Syncrude Boreal Open in Alberta. Was T6 after 54 holes and posted a 6-under 66 on the final day to finish at 13-under and win by one...Was solo third at the Times Colonist Island Savings Open in Ontario to start the year...Missed the cut at the BMW Charity Pro-Am on the Web.com Tour in his first Web.com Tour appearance and missed the cut at the RBC Canadian Open on the PGA TOUR.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Named Big East Freshman of the Year in 2009 and Big East Player of the Year in 2010.
tourBios.personal: Attended Highland Secondary School in Comox, British Columbia...Has one younger sister...Earliest golf memory is of Tiger Woods winning the 1997 Masters...Favorite course is the National GC of Canada and would like to play Royal Melbourne...Favorite sports teams are the Vancouver Canucks, Seattle Mariners, San Francisco 49ers and Miami Heat. Favorite athletes are LeBron James and Roger Federer...Enjoys watching ESPN's "First Take."...Favorite movies are "Happy Gilmore" and "Training Day" and likes books by author Dan Brown...Enjoys traveling to Seattle, Vancouver and San Diego...Says he'd like to trade places for a day with golfer Brad Faxon because "something's got to rub off." Would put Arnold Palmer, Fred Couples and Woods in his dream foursome...Says not many people know he started playing golf left-handed...Bucket list includes designing and building a golf course...Favorite motto is "If you do today what others won't, you'll do tomorrow what others can't."...Twitter account is @rileywheeldon09.

tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Capitalized on three under-par rounds, punctuated by a birdie on the 72nd hole in regulation, to earn a spot in a five-man playoff at the PC Financial Open...Eliminated on the first playoff hole, finishing T2 behind champion Drew Weaver...Recorded a T6 finish at The Players Cup...Carded four rounds in the 60s, including weekend rounds of 66-66, to T5 at the National Capital Open...Finished the season 23rd on the Order of Merit.



2014: Split time between the Mackenzie Tour and the Web.com Tour while dealing with a nagging hip injury throughout the year...Posted one top-10 and four top-25s in nine starts on the Mackenzie Tour to finish 53rd on the Order of Merit...Posted a T8 finish at the Syncrude Boreal Open in his first career title defense...Posted four top-25 finishes and ended the season 53rd on the Order of Merit. 



2013: Earned 2014 Web.com Tour status by finishing second on the PGA TOUR Canada Order of Merit...Made the cut in six of nine starts and had three top-10 finishes...Earned his first career win at The Syncrude Boreal Open in Alberta. Was T6 after 54 holes and posted a 6-under 66 on the final day to finish at 13-under and win by one...Was solo third at the Times Colonist Island Savings Open in Ontario to start the year...Missed the cut at the BMW Charity Pro-Am on the Web.com Tour in his first Web.com Tour appearance and missed the cut at the RBC Canadian Open on the PGA TOUR.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Named 2009 Big East Freshman of the Year and 2010 Big East Player of the Year...
tourBios.personal: Attended Highland Secondary School in Comox, British Columbia...Has one younger sister...Earliest golf memory is of Tiger Woods winning the 1997 Masters...Favorite course is the National GC of Canada and would like to play Royal Melbourne...Favorite sports teams are the Vancouver Canucks, Seattle Mariners, San Francisco 49ers and Miami Heat. Favorite athletes are LeBron James and Roger Federer...Enjoys watching ESPN's "First Take."...Favorite movies are "Happy Gilmore" and "Training Day" and likes books by author Dan Brown...Enjoys traveling to Seattle, Vancouver and San Diego...Says he'd like to trade places for a day with golfer Brad Faxon because "something's got to rub off." Would put Arnold Palmer, Fred Couples and Woods in his dream foursome...Says not many people know he started playing golf left-handed...Bucket list includes designing and building a golf course...Favorite motto is "If you do today what others won't, you'll do tomorrow what others can't."...Twitter account is @rileywheeldon09.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Mackenzie Tour-PGA T was 1st in 2013 at the The Syncrude Boreal Open Presented by AECON.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks 42nd in Scoring Average (Actual) on the Mackenzie Tour-PGA TOUR Canada.
